contentrichtext.text: {{other uses|St. Louis Blues (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox music genre |name=St Louis blues |color=white |bgcolor=#0000E1 |stylistic_origins= [[Blues]], [[jump blues]], [[ragtime]] and [[piano blues]] |cultural_origins=1950s [[St. Louis, Missouri]] |instruments= [[Piano]], [[vocals|singers]], [[drum]]s, [[upright bass|bass]] |popularity=1950s }} '''St. Louis blues''' is a type of [[blues]] music. It is usually more [[piano]]-based than other forms of the blues, and is closely related to the [[jump blues]], [[ragtime]] and [[piano blues]]. Typically, a small number of singers, a pianist and a few other [[musical instrument]]s (used primarily for [[rhythm]]) make up a [[musical ensemble|band]].<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/style/st-louis-blues-ma0000012094 |title=St. Louis Blues : Significant Albums, Artists and Songs, Most Viewed |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2012-12-10}}</ref> ==Notable musicians== *[[Chuck Berry]] *[[James Crutchfield]] *[[Teddy Darby]] *[[Walter Davis (blues)|Walter Davis]] *[[James "Stump" Johnson]] *[[Johnnie Johnson (musician)|Johnnie Johnson]] *[[Lonnie Johnson]] *[[Charley Jordan]] *[[Luella Miller]] *[[Robert Lee McCollum|Robert Nighthawk]] *[[Yank Rachell]] *[[Bennie Smith]] *[[Roosevelt Sykes]] *[[Henry Townsend (musician)|Henry Townsend]] *[[Ike Turner]] *[[Albert King]] *[[Little Milton]] ==See also== "[[St. Louis Blues (song)]]" for the [[W. C. Handy]] song. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{blues}} [[Category:Music of St. Louis, Missouri]] [[Category:Blues music genres]]
